alert.note: Alert for Eastern Norton Sound and Nulato Hills; Lower Koyukuk and Middle Yukon Valleys; Lower Yukon Valley; Southern Seward Peninsula Coast; St Lawrence Island and Bering Strait Coast; Upper Kuskokwim Valley; Yukon Delta (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 14 at 3:51PM AKST by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...Stormy Second Half Week Over Western Alaska... A weather system in the Western Bering Sea will spread its weather front over Southwest Alaska on Thursday. This will bring several inches of snow to Southwest Alaska and the Southwest Interior on Thursday. A stronger storm will move over the Yukon Delta on Friday. There is still a fair amount of uncertainty on the timing and track of this system. At this time it looks like this will bring between 2 and 6 inches of snow on Friday and Friday night to the Interior and West Coast south of Nome and Minchumina. It could also bring strong winds and a potential for blizzard conditions along the coast south of the Bering Strait, and southwest of Anvik. This Friday storm will need to be watched.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Norton Sound and Nulato Hills; Lower Koyukuk and Middle Yukon Valleys; Lower Yukon Valley; Southern Seward Peninsula Coast; St Lawrence Island and Bering Strait Coast; Upper Kuskokwim Valley; Yukon Delta
